intro: Tonestus kingii var. barnebyana, commonly known as the Barneby's tonestus, is a rare and ornamental plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that resemble a hand, with a deep green coloration and a slightly serrated margin. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a unique addition to shaded gardens. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
